text: [Music]
My name is Adrian McLuren and I am a
play test researcher here at Epic Games.
This is a very passiondriven role and so
it's important for me to know kind of
the fundamentals of what makes a game
look good. It's makes it a lot easier to
do when you appreciate and just enjoy
doing the research as well.
Specifically, my job as a play test
researcher is to put together tests and
scenarios in conjunction with really
anyone who is involved in the production
of the game to make sure that we're
gathering information about how people
internally feel about what we're making.
And then I put together reports and make
sure that that information gets
disseminated to the correct people. The
beauty of my role as a play test
researcher is any job where you deal
with information is going to transfer
really well to the world. Communication
specifically because a lot of what I
studied was how to gather information
and then give that information to other
people. But we also have people on the
team with data backgrounds. We have
people who are really skilled at putting
together surveys and presenting
information. I know uh one of my team
leads has a degree in astrophysics. Like
pretty much anything that you've studied
to where you've developed research
skills is going to transfer excellently
into the role. Probably the biggest
advice that I would give to anyone who's
looking for a role in play test research
is to get really good at speaking out
and asking questions. This is not a job
where you want to stay quiet.
specifically, we get into the habit
sometimes of hearing people give
feedback and writing it down and not
asking those follow-up questions.
Probably the thing that I enjoy most
about my job is at the end of the day,
I'm paid to play video games and to talk
to people about them. And a big part of
that is how people feel about games,
which to talk about something that you
already love and get to see reasons and
kind of the explanation why other people
love it too is great.
[Music]
